#summary Human Nerves

----

This page is intended to list all nerves of biological human, which connect mind to human limbs and visceral organs.
Related findings are structured by other research themes.

== SPINAL CORD NEURONS ==

  * *Fibers by thickness*
   * A-alpha motor/sensory (Ia, Ib): 12-22 mcm, 70-120 m/sec, low theshold, 2ms after stimulus (alpha-motoneurons, muscle spindle primary endings - Ia, Golgi tendon organs - Ib, touch)
   * A-beta sensory (II): 8-13 mcm, 40-70 m/sec, higher theshold, 4ms after stimulus (touch, kinesthesia, muscle spindle secondary endings)
   * A-gamma motor/sensory: 4-8 mcm, 15-40 m/sec, 6ms after stimulus (touch, pressure, gamma-motoneurons)
   * A-delta sensory (III): 1-4 mcm, 5-15 m/sec, 20ms after stimulus (pain, crude touch, pressure, temperature)
   * B motor: 1-3 mcm, 3-14 m/sec, preganglionic autonomic
   * C (cutaneous) motor/sensory (IV): 0.1-1 mcm, 0.2-2 m/sec, 60ms after stimulus (pain, touch, pressure, temperature, postganglionic autonomic)

http://www.intechopen.com/source/html/43833/media/image2.jpeg

  * *Sensory neurons*
   * proprioceptors: LI,LV, also LII (fast pain/temperature senses, A-delta)
   * nociceptors: LII,LI (slow pain/temperature senses, C, unmyelinated)
   * mechanoreceptors: LIII,LIV (proprioception, touch/position/kinesthetic senses, A-alpha, A-beta)
  * *Proprioception*
   * receptors origin: muscle spindle, Golgi tendon organ
   * muscle spindle receptor location: intrafusal fibers
   * intrafusal fiber types:
    * nuclear chain fibers - report static length of muscle (aligned in a single row), Ia/II/gamma
    * static nuclear bag fibers - report static length of muscle (bundle in fiber middle), Ia/II/gamma
    * dynamic nuclear bag fibers - report rate of change of muscle length (bundle in fiber middle), Ia/gamma
   * roman number fiber classification:
    * Ia - primary afferents, annulospiral endings, length and velocity
    * II - secondary afferents, flower spray endings, length only
    * Ib - Golgi tendon organ, report load being applied to muscle

http://classconnection.s3.amazonaws.com/997/flashcards/1355997/gif/reflexarcs1336087730891.gif

  * *Motoneurons*
   * alpha-motoneuron: extrafusal muscle fibres, A-alpha fibers (voluntary movement)
   * gamma-motoneuron: intrafusal muscle fibers, A-gamma fibers (muscle tonus, additional contracts to maintain sensitivity in stretched state)
   * preganglionic autonomic: B fibers
   * postganglionic autonomic: C finers
   * renshaw cell: axon collateral of alpha-motoneuron -> renshaw cell -> alpha-motoneuron (negative feedback)

== SPINAL CORD NUCLEI ==

http://ahuman.googlecode.com/svn/images/wiki/research/biomodel/spinal-cord-nuclei.jpg

*outer:*
  * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_LH_LCV Lateral Cervical Nucleus] (LCN) (lateral horn, low-threshold fast-conducting, tactile/pressure relay); sensory, spinocervical tract
  * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_LH_LSN Lateral Spinal Nucleus] (LSN) (lateral horn, relay in unmyelinated pathways between the periphery and brain, intersegmental integrator); sensory, spinohypothalamic tract/spinosolitary tract

*sensory:*
  * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_MG Marginal Nucleus] (MN), Apex of Posterior Horn, Nucleus Posteromarginalis - LI (A-delta/C, non-modulatable pain and temperature sensations); sensory, lateral spinothalamic tract; modulatory, dorsolateral fasciculus (from RVM); interneurons from SG; interneurons to IML
  * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_SG Substantia Gelatinosa] (SG), Rolando's Substance - LII (C, short - pain, temperature, long - mechanoreceptors; long inhibits short); modulatory, dorsolateral fasciculus (from VTA); interneurons to MN, CLN
  * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_NP Nucleus Proprius] (NPR), Main Sensory Nucleus, Proper Sensory Nucleus - LIII,LIV (A-beta, crude and pressure, 2-point discrimination, vibration); sensory: spinotectal tract/spinoolivary tract/spinocervical tract; interneurons to CLN
  * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_CL Clarke's Nucleus] (CLN), Nucleus Dorsalis, Posterior Thoracic Nucleus, Clarke's Column - LV, LVI (A-delta, secondary visceral afferents, unconscious proprioception): sensory, anterior spinothalamic tract/dorsal spinocerebellar tract/spinoreticular tract; interneurons from SG, NPR
  * *Central Nucleus*
   * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_IZ_CCV Central Cervical Nucleus] (CCN) - LVII (spinocerebellar sensory, relays neck proprioception to cerebellum, locomotion); sensory, spinoolivary tract/spinovestibular tract
   * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_IZ_CBS Centrobasalis Nucleus] (CBN) - LVII (spinocerebellar sensory, relays forelimb proprioception to cerebellum); sensory, rostral spinocerebellar tract

*motor:*
  * *Medial Motor Nuclei* (axial muscles motor neurons)
   * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PM Posteromedial Nucleus] (PMN), Dorsomedial Nucleus - LVIII (axial trunk flexors, T1-L2); motor, medial reticulospinal tract/ventral corticospinal tract
   * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM Ventromedial Nucleus] (VMN), Anteromedial Nucleus - LVIII (axial trunk extensors, inhibit flexors, all segments); motor, medial reticulospinal tract/ventral corticospinal tract
  * *Lateral Motor Nuclei* (distal muscles motor neurons)
   * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_IZ_RPL Retroposterolateral Nucleus] (RPL), Retrodorsolateral Nucleus - LVII (fingers, C8-T1/S1-S3, distal large motor neurons to small arm and leg finger muscles); motor, lateral corticospinal tract/rubrospinal tract
   * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PL Posterolateral Nucleus] (PLN), Dorsolateral Nucleus - LIX (distal flexors, C4-C8/L2-S1, hand/leg, distal muscles of forearm, hand, leg, foot); motor, lateral corticospinal tract/rubrospinal tract/lateral vestibulospinal tract
   * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_LM Ventrolateral Nucleus] (VLN), Anterolateral Nucleus - LIX (distal extensors, C4-C8/L2-S1, shoulder/hip, distal muscles of shoulder girdle, arm, hip, thigh); motor, lateral corticospinal tract/rubrospinal tract/lateral reticulospinal tract
   * [BrainRegionHMA_SC_VH_SAN Spinal Accessory Nucleus] (SAN) - LIX (neck, control neck to rotate head); motor, tectospinal tract/medial vestibulospinal tract
   * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PHR Phrenic Nucleus] (PHN) - LIX (diaphragm, conscious and autonomic control of breathing); motor, ventral corticospinal tract/bulbospinal tract

*autonomic:*
  * *Intermediolateral Cell Column*, Intermediate Zone:
   * [BrainRegionAVA_SC_IZ_IML Intermediolateral Nucleus] (IML) - LVII (autonomic, visceral structures); sympathetic, visceral motor
   * [BrainRegionAVA_SC_IZ_IMM Intermediomedial Nucleus] (IMM) - LVII (visceral sensory); sensory, ventral spinocerebellar tract
   * [BrainRegionVBA_SC_IZ_CSC Ciliospinal Center] (CSC) - LVII (autonomic, visceral structures); modulatory, hypothalamospinal tract; motor, tectospinal tract
  * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_IZ_SPCR Sacral Precerebellar Nucleus] (SPN), Sacral Parasympathetic Nucleus, Stilling's Sacral Nucleus - LVII (S1-S3, psym. to large intestine; pelvic nerve); motor, dorsolateral fasciculus
  * [BrainRegionAVA_SC_VH_ONF Onuf's Nucleus] (ONN), Gert's Nucleus, Lumbosacral Nucleus - LIX (dorsomedial: urination, orgasmic muscular contractions, dorsolateral: defecation); motor, dorsolateral fasciculus
  * [BrainRegionAVA_SC_CC_DCN Dorsal Commissural Nucleus] (DCN) - LX (integrate direct/indirect excitatory and inhibitory fast inputs, modulate by slow excitatory responses); interneurons

== SPINAL CORD TRACTS ==

http://intranet.tdmu.edu.ua/data/kafedra/internal/anatomy/classes_stud/en/med/lik/ptn/1/19%20SPINAL%20CORD.%20BASE%20OF%20THE%20BRAIN.files/image044.jpg

*MIXED*:
  * *dorsolateral fasciculus*, dorsolateral funiculus
   * *tract of Lissauer*, fasciculus of Lissauer, tract/zone of Lissauer, intraspinal (DLF, discriminative pain and temperature information - location, intensity and quality)
    * A-delta (fast, pain duration equals to stimulus duration) pain fibers to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_MG Marginal Nucleus] (N2) to spinothalamic tract
    * C (slow, pain duration exceeds simulus duration, substance P) pain fibers to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_SG Substantia Gelatinosa] interneurons
   * *dorsolateral/posterolateral tract*, descending
    * [BrainRegionFBA_MM_PAG Periaqueductal Gray Matter] (N1) to 
     * RVM ([BrainRegionFBA_HM_RP Raphe Nucleus of Medulla], [BrainRegionHMA_HP_PRF_GCR Gigantocellular Reticular Nucleus]) (N2) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_MG Marginal Nucleus] (N3) (inhibit pain, serotonine)
     * [BrainRegionMBA_HP_BR Barrington's Nucleus] (N2) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_IZ_SPCR Sacral Precerebellar Nucleus], [BrainRegionAVA_SC_VH_ONF Onuf's Nucleus] (N3) to colon, rectum, bladder, penis, vagina
    * [BrainRegionFBA_MM_VTA Ventral Tegmental Area] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_SG Substantia Gelatinosa] (N2) (inhibit pain, dopamine, reward, placebo)
    * [BrainRegionFBA_HP_LC Locus Coeruleus] (N1) to [BrainRegionAVA_SC_IZ_IML Intermediolateral Nucleus] (N2) (inhibit pain, norepinephrine - physiological responses to stress and panic)
  * *medial longitudinal fasciculus* (MLF): 
   * *ascending*
    * [BrainRegionVBA_HP_ABD Abducens Nucleus] to [BrainRegionVBA_MM_OCN Oculomotor Nucleus] to muscles of eye
    * [BrainRegionBMA_HP_VB Vestibular Nucleus] to [BrainRegionVBA_MM_OCN Oculomotor Nucleus] to muscles of eye
    * [BrainRegionBMA_HP_VB Vestibular Nucleus] to [BrainRegionVBA_MM_TRH Trochlear Nucleus] to muscles of eye
   * *descending*
    * [BrainRegionHMA_MM_CJ Cajal Nucleus] to [BrainRegionVBA_MM_OCN Oculomotor Nucleus] to muscles of eye
    * [BrainRegionBMA_HP_VB Vestibular Nucleus] to [BrainRegionHMA_SC_VH_SAN Spinal Accessory Nucleus] to muscles of neck

*ASCENDING*:
  * *dorsal column*, posterior column, medial lemniscus (well-localized discriminative fine touch and proprioception, alpha/beta mechanoreceptors, conscious):
   * *fasciculus gracilis*, tract of Goll (A-beta, tactile and pressure, thoracic-toward-contralateral and cervical slices): receptors of thoracic and lower limbs to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_HM_GR Gracile Nucleus] (N2) to [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VPL Ventral Posterolateral Nucleus] (N3) to [BrainRegionSMA_NC_PG_S1 Somatosensory Cortex] (BA 3b)
   * *fasciculus cuneatus*, tract of Burdach (A-beta, fine touch, fine pressure, vibration, and proprioception, sacral-toward-contralateral and lumbar slices): receptors of C1-T6 dermatomes to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_HM_CU Cuneate Nucleus] (N2) to 
    * [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VPL Ventral Posterolateral Nucleus] (neck, trunk, and extremities) (N3) to [BrainRegionSMA_NC_PG_S1 Somatosensory Cortex] (BA 3b)
    * [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VPM Ventral Posteromedial Nucleus] (head) (N3) to [BrainRegionSMA_NC_PG_S1 Somatosensory Cortex] (BA 3b)
  * *anterolateral system*:
   * *spinothalamic tract* (STT, conscious):
    * *trigeminothalamic tract*, neospinothalamic tract (TTT):
     * head, face and intraoral structures nociceptors to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_TRG Trigeminal Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionHMA_HM_TGM_STR Spinal Trigeminal Nucleus] (N2) to [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VPM Ventral Posteromedial Nucleus] (N3) to [BrainRegionSMA_NC_PG_S1 Somatosensory Cortex] (BA 1,2)
     * nociceptors of cranial nerves 7,9,10 to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_TRG Trigeminal Ganglion], [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_JUG Jugular Ganglion], [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_NOD Nodose Ganglion] (N1) to spinal trigeminal nucleus (N2) to [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VPM Ventral Posteromedial Nucleus] (N3) to [BrainRegionSMA_NC_PG_S1 Somatosensory Cortex] (BA 1,2)
     * C-fibers of face dull, burning pain, deep, aching pain, temperature and crude touch to [BrainRegionHMA_HP_PTP_PTR Principal Trigeminal Nucleus] (N1) to [BrainRegionHMA_HM_TGM_STR Spinal Trigeminal Nucleus] (N2) to [BrainRegionBGA_FD_TH_CM Centromedian Nucleus of Thalamus] and [BrainRegionBGA_FD_TH_PF Parafascicular Nucleus of Thalamus] (N3) to [BrainRegionSMA_NC_PG_S1 Somatosensory Cortex] (BA 3)
    * *paleospinothalamic tract* (cervical-anterior-toward-contralateral, thoracic, lumbar, sacral-lateral slices):
     * *anterior spinothalamic tract*, anterolateral tract (ASTT, both sides, non-discriminative touch & pressure): crude touch information to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_SG Substantia Gelatinosa] (N2) to 
      * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_CL Clarke's Nucleus] (N3) to [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VPL Ventral Posterolateral Nucleus] (N4) to [BrainRegionSMA_NC_PG_S1 Somatosensory Cortex]
      * [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VPL Ventral Posterolateral Nucleus] (N3) to [BrainRegionSMA_NC_PG_S1 Somatosensory Cortex]
     * *lateral spinothalamic tract* (LSTT, pain & thermal sense-temperature): free nerve endings (pain and temperature, A-delta/C fibers) to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_MG Marginal Nucleus] (N2) to 
      * [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VPI Ventral Posteroinferior Nucleus] (N3) to [BrainRegionPHA_NC_INS_PIC Posterior Insular Cortex]
      * [BrainRegionFCA_FD_TH_MD Mediodorsal Nucleus of Thalamus] (N3) to [BrainRegionCGA_NC_DACG Dorsal Anterior Cingulate Area] 
    * *spinovestibular tract*: C1-C4,neuromuscular spindles and Golgi tendon organs to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_IZ_CCV Central Cervical Nucleus] (N2) to [BrainRegionBMA_HP_VB Vestibular Nucleus]
   * *tracts close to LSTT*
    * *spinoreticular tract*: free nerve endings (crude touch, temperature, pain, afferent for RF, conscious) to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_CL Clarke's Nucleus] (N2) to:
     * [BrainRegionMBA_HM_RF_MED Medullary Reticular Formation]
     * Pontine Reticular Formation ([BrainRegionHMA_HP_PRF_GCR Gigantocellular Reticular Nucleus], [BrainRegionHMA_HP_PRF_RPO Oral Pontine Reticular Nucleus], [BrainRegionHMA_HP_PRF_CRF Caudal Pontine Reticular Nucleus]) (N3) to [BrainRegionBGA_FD_TH_CM Centromedian Nucleus of Thalamus] (N4)
     * [BrainRegionFBA_MM_CNF Cuneiform Nucleus] (N3) to [BrainRegionBGA_FD_TH_CM Centromedian Nucleus of Thalamus] (N4)
    * *spinotectal tract*: free nerve endings (ST, crude touch, temperature, pain, spinovisual reflexes, head/eye movement toward stimulus source) to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_NP Nucleus Proprius] (N2) to [BrainRegionMBA_MM_SC_DEEP Deep Superior Colliculus] (N3)
    * *spinoolivary tract*, Helweg's tract (SOT, lateral, proprioceptive and cutaneous organs to cerebellum): proprioception information, cutaneous impulses from muscles and tendons to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_NP Nucleus Proprius], [BrainRegionBMA_SC_IZ_CCV Central Cervical Nucleus] (N2) to [BrainRegionBMA_HM_IO Inferior Olivary Nucleus] (N3) to [BrainRegionMBA_HP_CR Cerebellum] (automatic movements of head, neck & upper limb)
   * *spinomesencephalic tract*: A-delta/C fibers to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_MG Marginal Nucleus] (N2) to [BrainRegionFBA_MM_PAG Periaqueductal Gray Matter]
   * *spinohypothalamic tract*: A-delta,C fibers to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to 
    * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_LH_LSN Lateral Spinal Nucleus] (N2) to hypothalamus - [BrainRegionHTA_FD_HT_LT Lateral Nucleus], [BrainRegionHTA_FD_HT_DM Dorsomedial Hypothalamic Nucleus], anterior nuclei ([BrainRegionHTA_FD_HT_PV Paraventricular Nucleus], [BrainRegionHTA_FD_HT_SCN Suprachiasmatic Nucleus], [BrainRegionHTA_FD_HT_SO Supraoptic Nucleus]) (endocrine, motivational responses to stimuli)
    * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_MG Marginal Nucleus] (N2) to [BrainRegionHTA_FD_HT_PO Preoptic Area]
   * *spinosolitary tract*: C fibers to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_LH_LSN Lateral Spinal Nucleus] (N3) to [BrainRegionHMA_HM_SOL Solitary Nucleus]
   * *spinocervical tract*: lumbosacral A-delta fibers to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_NP Nucleus Proprius] (N2) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_LH_LCV Lateral Cervical Nucleus] (N3) to:
    * [BrainRegionFBA_MM_PAG Periaqueductal Gray Matter] (PAG)
    * [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VPL Ventral Posterolateral Nucleus] (N3) to neocortex
  * *spinocerebellar tracts* (proprioceptive sensation, subconscious, very lateral slice):
   * *cuneocerebellar tract*: C1-C7,proprioceptive/fine touch/vibration to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_HM_ACU Accessory Cuneate Nucleus] (N2) to [BrainRegionMBA_HP_CR Cerebellum]
   * *dorsal spinocerebellar tract*, posterior spinocerebellar tract (PSCT): neuromuscular spindles and Golgi tendon organs (trunk and lower limb) to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_CL Clarke's Nucleus] (N2) to (unilaterally) [BrainRegionMBA_HP_CR Cerebellum]
   * *ventral spinocerebellar tract*, anterior spinocerebellar tract, Gower's tract (ASCT): C8-L3,proprioceptive/fine touch/vibration (body, legs) to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionAVA_SC_IZ_IMM Intermediomedial Nucleus] (N2) to (bilaterally in C8-L3) [BrainRegionMBA_HP_CR Cerebellum] (to cortex and globose, emboliform nuclei)
   * *rostral spinocerebellar tract* (RSCT): C8-L3,proprioceptive/fine touch/vibration (body, legs) to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_IZ_CBS Centrobasalis Nucleus] (N2) to [BrainRegionMBA_HP_CR Cerebellum] (bilaterally)

*DESCENDING*:
  * *corticospinal tracts*, pyramidal tract (CST, conscious):
   * *lateral corticospinal tract* (LCST, cervical-medial, thoracic, lumbar-lateral, distal muscles, decussating to contralateral and ipsilateral): cortex BA 1-4,6 (N1) to
    * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_IZ_RPL Retroposterolateral Nucleus] (RPL) (N2) to distal limb finger muscles
    * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PL Posterolateral Nucleus] (PLN) (N2) to distal limb flexors muscles
    * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_LM Ventrolateral Nucleus] (VLN) (N2) to distal limb extensors muscles
   * *ventral corticospinal tract*, anterior/medial corticospinal tract, direct pyramidal tract, anterior cerebrospinal fasciculus (VCST, axial, proximal muscles, ipsilateral): cortex BA 1-4,6 (N1) to:
    * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PM Posteromedial Nucleus] (PMN) (N2) to axial flexors muscles
    * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM Ventromedial Nucleus] (VMN) (N2) to axial extensors muscles
    * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PHR Phrenic Nucleus] (N2) to diaphragm, intercostal nerves to intercostal muscles
  * *subconscious motor tracts*:
   * *ventral motor tracts* (between ventral roots and VSCT)
    * *rubrospinal tract*, tract of Monakow (facilitates flexors activity, subconscious): [BrainRegionMBA_MM_RD Red Nucleus] (magnocellular neurons) (N1) to (mediation of voluntary movement by cerebelum):
     * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_IZ_RPL Retroposterolateral Nucleus] (RPL) (N2) to distal limb finger muscles
     * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PL Posterolateral Nucleus] (PLN) (N2) to distal limb flexors muscles
     * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_LM Ventrolateral Nucleus] (VLN) (N2) to distal limb extensors muscles
    * *vestibulospinal tract* (facilitates extensors activity, subconscious):
     * *lateral vestibulospinal tract*: [BrainRegionBMA_HP_VB Vestibular Nucleus] (lateral,inferior) (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PL Posterolateral Nucleus] (N2) to arms, legs (modulates muscle tone to maintain equilibrium)
     * *medial vestibulospinal tract*: [BrainRegionBMA_HP_VB Vestibular Nucleus] (medial) (N1) to [BrainRegionHMA_SC_VH_SAN Spinal Accessory Nucleus] (N2) to neck muscles (ensures neck and trunk movements coordinated with eye movements)
    * *reticulospinal tract* (RST, control by hypothalamus of sympathetic and sacral parasympathetic outflow, subconscious):
     * *lateral reticulospinal tract*, pontine reticulospinal tract: 
      * [BrainRegionHMA_HP_PRF_CRF Caudal Pontine Reticular Nucleus] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_LM Ventrolateral Nucleus] (N2) to distal muscles (exciting anti-gravity, extensor muscles)
      * [BrainRegionHMA_HP_PRF_RPO Oral Pontine Reticular Nucleus] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_LM Ventrolateral Nucleus] (N2) to distal muscles (inhibit stretch reflexes)
     * *medial reticulospinal tract*, medullary reticulospinal tract: [BrainRegionMBA_HM_RF_MED Medullary Reticular Formation], [BrainRegionHMA_HP_PRF_GCR Gigantocellular Reticular Nucleus] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_VM Ventromedial Nucleus] (N2) to axial muscles (inhibiting excitatory axial extensor muscles of movement, excite flexors)
     * *hypothalamospinal tract*, oculosympathetic pathway: [BrainRegionHTA_FD_HT_PV Paraventricular Nucleus] (N1) to [BrainRegionVBA_SC_IZ_CSC Ciliospinal Center] (N2) to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SYM_SCG Superior Cervical Ganglion] (N3) to dilator muscle of iris
    * *tectospinal tract*, colliculospinal tract (reflex postural movementa - coordinate head, neck, and eye movements by visual and auditory stimuli): [BrainRegionMBA_MM_SC_DEEP Deep Superior Colliculus] (N1) to 
     * [BrainRegionHMA_SC_VH_SAN Spinal Accessory Nucleus] (C1-C4) (N2) to axial muscles of neck
     * [BrainRegionVBA_SC_IZ_CSC Ciliospinal Center] (N2) to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SYM_SCG Superior Cervical Ganglion] (N3) to muscles of iris
   * *bulbospinal tract*, solitariospinal tract: (see http://www.slideshare.net/LawrenceJames/regulation-of-respiration)
    * [BrainRegionHMA_HM_SOL Solitary Nucleus] (autonomic respiration, start) (N1) to [BrainRegionHMA_HM_AMB Ambiguus Nucleus], [BrainRegionHMA_HM_RA Retroambiguus Nucleus] (expiratory cencer, active when forced breathing) (N2) to nucleus ambiguus (inspiratory center) (N3) to
     * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PHR Phrenic Nucleus] (N4) to diaphragm, intercostal nerves to intercostal muscles
    * [BrainRegionBMA_HP_PB Parabrachial Nucleus] (pacemaker, controls rate and pattern of breathing) (N1) to [BrainRegionHMA_HM_AMB Ambiguus Nucleus] (N2) to 
     * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_PHR Phrenic Nucleus] (N3) to diaphragm, intercostal nerves to intercostal muscles

*INTRASPINAL*:
  * A-alpha receptors to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to 
   * alpha motor neurons (N2) to the same agonist muscles (myotatic/stretch reflex to support increased load)
   * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_SG Substantia Gelatinosa] GABA interneurons (N2) to alpha motor neurons (N3) to antagonist muscles (reciprocal inhibition in stretch reflex)
  * A-delta/C receptors to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_SG Substantia Gelatinosa] (interneurons) (N2) to

   * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_CL Clarke's Nucleus]
  * viscerosensory information to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_MG Marginal Nucleus] (N2) to [BrainRegionAVA_SC_IZ_IML Intermediolateral Nucleus] (IML) to white rami (sympathetic tract, preganglionic fibers)
  * [BrainRegionBMA_SC_IZ_SPCR Sacral Precerebellar Nucleus] to [BrainRegionAVA_SC_VH_ONF Onuf's Nucleus]
  * C fibers of intestine and bladder to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionAVA_SC_VH_ONF Onuf's Nucleus] (N3) to [BrainRegionBMA_SC_IZ_SPCR Sacral Precerebellar Nucleus] (N4) to
   * [BrainRegionAVA_PN_PSYM_PPG Pelvic Peripheral Ganglion] (bladder ganglion) (N5) to detrusor muscle of bladder (via pelvic nerve, excite bladder, relax uretra)
   * colon, rectum
  * A-delta/C sacral fibers to [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG Dorsal Root Ganglion] (N1) to [BrainRegionAVA_SC_IZ_IML Intermediolateral Nucleus] (N2) to [BrainRegionAVA_SC_CC_DCN Dorsal Commissural Nucleus] (N3) to
   * hypogastric nerve

== FUNCTIONAL CLASSIFICATION OF INNERVATION ==

  * see http://musom.marshall.edu/anatomy/grosshom/z_cranerv1.html

*General Innervation - like spinal cord*:
  * *GSE* (General Somatic Efferent) - motor to somatic voluntary skeletal muscles (derived from somites)
  * *GSA* (General Somatic Afferent) - sensory to skin, joints, muscle and tendon receptor endings, nasal and oral cavity
  * *GVE* (General Visceral Efferent) = Autonomic Efferents - motor to smooth muscles in general and smooth muscles of  skin (arrector pilae muscles) and blood vessels, secretomotor to glands
  * *GVA* (General Visceral Afferent) - sensory to gut and its derivatives, pharynx, blood vessels, glands and internal organs

*Special Innervation - only found in head*:
  * *SSA* (Special Somatic  Afferent) - special senses of vision, auditory sensation and vestibular apparatus
  * *SVA* (Special Visceral Afferents) - chemical senses of taste and by analogy smell
  * *SVE* (Special Visceral Efferents) - motor to voluntary skeletal muscles derived from branchial arches (these muscles develop in association with pharynx, which is rostral end of gut and therefore visceral)

== MULTI-CATEGORY NERVES ==

  * *nerve of pterygoid canal* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne174.htm NERVE OF THE PTERYGOID CANAL]; vidian nerve) ORIGIN={union of deep petrosal nerve and greater petrosal nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={pterygopalatine ganglion and branches}; MODALITY={parasympathetic and sympathetic}; FIBERS={sympathetic:see deep petrosal nerve (carotid nerve); parasympathetic: see greater petrosal nerve (facial nerve)}
  * *pterygopalatine nerves* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne150.htm NASAL BRANCHES OF PTERYGOPALATINE GANGLION]; sphenopalatine nerves) DISTRIBUTION={the two nerves which connect the maxillary nerve to the pterygopalatine GANGLION}; MODALITY={they are the sensory roots of the ganglion}; FIBERS={GSA:all maxillary sensory from pterygopalatine to trigeminal; GVE:great and deep petrosal to lacrimal gland}
<img src="http://www.dartmouth.edu/~humananatomy/figures/chapter_48/48-7_files/image002.jpg">
  * *vagus nerve*
   * *vagus nerve, anterior trunk* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne250.htm ANTERIOR VAGUS NERVE],[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne261.htm LEFT BRANCH OF ANTERIOR VAGUS],[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne270.htm RIGHT BRANCH OF ANTERIOR VAGUS]; left); ORIGIN={consists primarily of fibers from the left vagus, but also contains a few fibers from the right vagus nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={contributes to the esophageal plexus}
   * *vagus nerve, posterior trunk* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne267.htm POSTERIOR VAGUS NERVE]; right); ORIGIN={branch of the vagus nerve, consists primarily of fibers from the right vagus, but also contains a few fibers from the left vagus}; DISTRIBUTION={contributes to the esophageal plexus}
